channel.title: sass on Sharynne Azhar
channel.description: Recent content in sass on Sharynne Azhar

item.title: Command Line Sass
item.description: Turns out there is a way to use SASS without an application like Rails or Compass. It is fairly easy to get it up and running, especially if you are developing on a Mac because Ruby already comes pre-installed! ️️Otherwise, you’ll need to install Ruby on your computer. After Ruby is installed, you need to install SASS. Just run the following: gem install sass Note: if you run into errors, you might need to use the sudo command.
